body:
FIPS-compliant machines reject md5 hashing by default

On some systems, the `hashlib` library for python has a `usedforsecurity` option. This attempts to set that as `False` where possible to make use of `md5` hashes but also prints a warning (the goal being that a package installer can add a PR to update the checksums for the packages they build).
title: Support MD5 with a warning when OpenSSL is compiled in FIPS mode
